column4: anyone know why the ubuntu system monitor takes between 45 and 60% of my proc at all times that its running?
Because it is programmed so that it takes so many ressources. It updates graphics too often.
ahh, is that why the names all go blank when i scroll?
I believe so, yes.
ok, so how do i replace the tray's system "widget's" double click function to use gtop or such?
ok, so how do i replace the tray's system "widget's" double click function to use gtop or such?
I don't know. Sorry.
depends on what sound system/server your running

The Integrated circuit  'Realtek ALC202' is described as an "AC'97 compatible audio codec having several stereo and mono inputs and outputs." Why does my laptop computer need an additional IC 'ALI 5451' (an ALSA mixer)?
ahh, im not sure, but my cs46xx in my desktop is the same way, i think its partialy the way ALSA handels direct sound output vs buffered or piped output
Thank you for your comment.
where did Valkyrie post multiple lines?
You can find that out most easily yourself.
what the hell are you talking about?!?!?
You put me a question, and I answered to it.

i was defending Valkyrie, you told him not to use enter as a punctuation, which when i lastlog Valkyrie i dont see multiple lines of one long sentance, so i questioned your interpritationn wondering where exactly Valkyrie had used enter as a punct. mark

It is trivial to scroll back in your IRC client's log to find out. I wil do it just once for you: "[07:11] <Valkyrie> Esat, Flash suchs =P; [07:11] <Valkyrie> Sucks; [07:11] <Valkyrie> Lemme correct this.; [07:11] <Valkyrie> Flash sucks ; SPECIALLY with Firefox."
it's important to learn about /lastlog try this in your irc client /lastlog gartral
That is a bad idea.
why?
Because KDE is a complicated program consisting of many components.
ok, as long as I can switch back.. and it doesn't auto-replace gdm

Instaling KDE will not automatically auto-replace gdm. But having installed KDE you cannot simply "switch" back to having no KDE. Because Ubuntu has made too many metapackages. This would mean rather much effort by hand.
